Based on the preferences you've given me, I would recommend two movies:

- "Passion" (2011) directed by Joseph Ruben tells the story of Jack Passion, a man who has defied social convention and become an ambassador for the sport of competitive beard growing. Through good times and bad, he has pushed on to become the two time world beard champion. He shares this inspirational story with us and guides us through his world in a 6 minute narrative doc. He considers what his world has become due to his beard and contemplates the thought of a world without. The movie is well-made and tells an inspiring story that can help viewers feel more motivated about their own lives.

- "Donnie Brasco" (1997) directed by Martin Scorsese tells the story of Donnie Brasco, a young man who has become obsessed with the lifestyle of mobster Francis Bonaparte. As Donnie becomes more involved in Francis' life, he begins to question his own values and choices. The movie is well-made and tells an inspiring story that can help viewers feel more motivated about their own lives.

Overall, both "Passion" and "Donnie Brasco" are well-made movies that tell inspiring stories. As such, I would recommend both "Passion" and "Donnie Brasco" to anyone who enjoys watching inspiring stories on the big screen.
